results.title: The News parade: San Francisco World's Fair
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage of the San Francisco World’s Fair held during 1939-1940 including: pioneers with oxcart, sailing ship and train; different parlours, parks, fountains, entertainment parlours, crowds. Staged spectacle on the settling of the West. Replica of an old mission, Japanese architecture, the Australia building, Chinese college and a replica of a Chinese walled city. Aerial shots of 400 acres of the fair grounds.

results.title: The News
results.brief_description: Explains how news is gathered and disseminated in Germany. From an enormous amount of information culled from reporters, foreign correspondents, news agencies, radio satellites and many other sources, the editors shape the final story. This news story is spread within the country and overseas by radio, television, illuminated news signs, films, radio picture transmission newspapers and other media.

results.title: The Newcomers: inhabiting a new land
results.creator_credit: Eric Till, Pat Ferns, Richard Nielsen and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Self-contained dramatisation concerning immigrants settling in a new land. John Symons, a Scottish radical, and his wife Margaret come to make a new life in Upper Canada. Symons faces the same challenges many settlers did during that period - poor farmland, back-breaking work for which he is ill-suited, isolation, a hard climate, and disease. Through perserverance and his own unconventional character, he is able to take advantage of the opportunities offered in the new world. He is a gifted entrepreneur. In his lifetime he becomes a wealthy businessman and landowner.

results.title: The Newcomers
results.creator_credit: David Bennett, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: All across Canada, at every level, national life is being enriched and strengthened by the talents and skills, as diverse as the countries from which they come, which are being poured into their adopted land by immigrants from the British Isles and Europe. This film travels to many places from coast to coast to present a visual inventory of the many ways in which Canada’s expansion is being helped by the newcomers, who see fresh opportunities to develop existing resources—both economically and culturally—and who also arrive as the purveyors of specialized knowledge from abroad.

results.title: The New Zealanders
results.brief_description: Life in New Zealand. Countryside, cities and typical homes; transport; the Maoris; parliament; schools; child care; free health and educational services; agriculture as the mainstay of the economy; the state of secondary industry; hydro-electric and geothermal power; maintaining standards in primary products for export; the arts, sports and recreations; thermal regions; a Maori pah.

results.title: The New Zealand school dental service
results.brief_description: Training of school dental nurses at the main dental clinic, Wellington, and work of the young nurses in the primary schools. Shows features of this service which is unique in the world.

results.title: The New traders
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter, Gerard Holdsworth, Unilever Films and United Africa Company
results.brief_description: In town and village modern merchandising is changing the habits, customs and outlook of the peoples of Nigeria and Ghana. The African retailer is adapting his old trading skills learned in the traditional market stalls, and applying up-to-date techniques. Shows something of the way in which the United Africa Company is contributing to the part these new traders are now playing.

results.title: The New tax system : 'How to' series
results.brief_description: This video contains the four videos in the “How to” series that have been produced by the Australian Taxation Office to assist with the implementation of the new Goods and Services Tax. It contains information about who should register and how too register for an ABN, the new Business Activity Statement, the requirements and importance of good record keeping and the Pay As You Go system. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: The New stone age
results.brief_description: Shows a Stone Age village in the Orkneys which was recovered from the sand dunes. Features houses, furniture and effects telling of the life and customs of Stone Age people. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
